page.title: 01South of Oakley to the M3
page.content: The land in this area is mainly rural comprising four{farms,}several areas of woodland or copse and some housing. The main electric{railway}line from Waterloo to Southampton crosses the north-west corner and the{M3 Motorway the south-east corner. There are several{industrial units}near this motorway and in Pardown in the north. Most of the area is farmland, mainly arable or sheep farming. There are two {residential areas,}one which makes up the south of Oakley village. These are mainly bungalows or detached houses but there are also two small council estates. The second area has a number of private residences on the outskirts of{Kempshott}made up of semi-detached, detached and a few terraced houses. There is a half hourly bus service operating in alternate directions serving Oakley.
